block.p: More than 40,000 Los Angeles County employees -- mostly clerical and service workers -- walked off the job at welfare clinics, beaches, libraries and the marriage license bureau to protest stalled negotiations on a new contract. Leaders of Local 660 of the Service Employees International Union agreed to return to work the next day, after a plea from Cardinal Roger Roger M. Mahony, who said the strike was hurting the poor. But a separate strike by bus and subway operators dragged into a fourth week.
